009
010package imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
013import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
014
015/**
016 * This class represents a pure 2D rotation about the coordinate origin 
017 * (as a special case of affine mapping).
018 * It can be assumed that every instance of this class is indeed a rotation.
019 */
020public class Rotation2D extends AffineMapping2D {
021        
022        /**
023         * Constructor. Creates a 2D rotation by a given
024         * angle about the origin.
025         * @param alpha rotation angle (in radians)
026         */
027        public Rotation2D(double alpha) {
028                super(
029                         Math.cos(alpha), -Math.sin(alpha), 0,
030                         Math.sin(alpha),  Math.cos(alpha), 0);
031        }
032        
033        /**
034         * Auxiliary constructor used internally for duplicating instances.
035         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
036         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
037         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
038         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
039         */
040        protected Rotation2D(double a00, double a01, double a10, double a11) {
041                super(a00, a01, 0, a10, a11, 0);
042        }
043        
044        /**
045         * Constructor. 
046         * Creates a new {@link Rotation2D} object from an existing instance.
047         * @param m a {@link Rotation2D} instance
048         */
049        public Rotation2D(Rotation2D m) {
050                this(m.a00, m.a01, m.a10, m.a11);
051        }
052        
053        // ----------------------------------------------------------
054        
055        /**
056         * Concatenates this rotation A with another rotation B and returns
057         * a new rotation C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
058         * @param B the second rotation
059         * @return the concatenated rotations
060         */
061        public Rotation2D concat(Rotation2D B) {
062                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
063                return new Rotation2D(C[0][0], C[0][1], C[1][0], C[1][1]);
064        }
065        
066        @Override
067        public Rotation2D duplicate() {
068                return new Rotation2D(this);
069        }
070        
071        @Override
072        public Rotation2D getInverse() {
073                return new Rotation2D(a00, -a01, -a10, a11);
074        }
075        
076        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
077        
078        /**
079         * For testing only.
080         * @param args ignored
081         */
082        public static void main(String[] args) {
083                PrintPrecision.set(6);
084                Rotation2D R = new Rotation2D(0.5);
085                double[][] A = R.getTransformationMatrix();
086                
087                System.out.println("A = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
088                System.out.println();
089                
090                AffineMapping2D Ri = R.getInverse();
091                double[][] Ai = Ri.getTransformationMatrix();
092                
093                System.out.println("Ai = \n" + Matrix.toString(Ai));
094                
095                double[][] I = Matrix.multiply(A, Ai);
096                System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
097        }
098}
099
